hints.content: Start by understanding the problem statement. You need to replace each number in the array with the sum of its digits. For example, the number 12 becomes 1 + 2 = 3.
Consider how to calculate the sum of digits for a given number. You can repeatedly divide the number by 10 and add the remainder to a sum until the number is 0.
Think about how you will iterate through the array. You need to apply the digit sum calculation to each element in the nums array.
As you replace each element with its digit sum, keep track of the minimum value found so far. This can be done using a variable initialized to a very large number.
Remember to handle each number individually. After calculating the digit sum for a number, compare it with the current minimum and update the minimum if necessary.
Consider edge cases, such as when all numbers are single digits. In this case, the minimum will simply be the smallest number in the original array.
What happens if there are multiple numbers that yield the same minimum digit sum? Ensure your logic correctly identifies the minimum, even if there are ties.
You can use a helper function to calculate the digit sum to keep your code organized. This function can take an integer as input and return its digit sum.
After processing all elements, your final step will be to return the minimum value found. Make sure your return statement is correctly placed after the loop.
To summarize your approach: iterate through the nums array, compute the digit sum for each element, and maintain a variable to track the minimum digit sum. Finally, return that minimum.

questionNotes: Return the minimum element after all replacements.
Ensure to handle cases where multiple elements yield the same minimum digit sum.
